item.title: Low grip road surface before the pedestrian crossing on the roundabout at the junction of Albion Road & Highland Road., 23rd December
item.description:
An accident happened on 18 December 2025 at 7.45am in the rain & dark when one car stopped suddenly for the pedestrian crossing on the exit of the roundabout at the junction of Albion Road & Highland Road & the car following braked hard & skidded into the back of the leading car. The road surface offers no grip in the wet as it is made up of many polished granite pieces. See photo. The approach to many pedestrian crossings in the town have abrasive anti slip coatings to prevent accidents & this crossing should have the same coating. The approach is downhill which does not help. There is a blind spot caused by the A-Pillar in the car when turning left onto the roundabout from upper Highland Road towards the pedestrian crossing & you cannot see pedestrians waiting to cross from the left until the last moment. This crossing needs the anti slip coating to prevent accidents & protect pedestrians. Alternatively, move the crossing a little further down the road towards Gravel Hill.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albion Road, Barnehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish Dumped, 23rd December
item.description:
This has been ongoing. Someone has dumped a pile of old clothing and rubbish onto the property and pathway, making it unbearable to walk by and to live. This keeps happening, It is very unsanitary to walk by because I am not sure what is being dumped, I feel unsafe with all the rubbish dumped.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Abbey Grove, Abbey Wood
Report on FixMyStreet
